key_points: Joe Biden inaugurated as the 46th president of the United States.
Biden sworn in with a family heirloom Bible, vows to preserve the US Constitution.
Becomes the oldest US president in history amid a scaled-back ceremony due to COVID-19 and security concerns.
Donald Trump breaks tradition by not attending Biden's inauguration, nor meeting with him.
Top Republicans and former Presidents (Obama, Bush, Clinton) attend, while Jimmy Carter abstains due to COVID-19.
Kamala Harris makes history as the first Black, first woman, and first Asian American vice president.
Harris was sworn in by Justice Sonia Sotomayor, using two Bibles including one owned by Thurgood Marshall.
Increased security with thousands of National Guard troops following the January 6 Capitol siege.
The National Mall was filled with nearly 200,000 flags and 56 pillars of light to represent US states and territories.
The inauguration takes place during a tumultuous time of political divide, economic turmoil, and a devastating pandemic.
